title: Origi ready for hectic 10 days
text:
Divock Origi facing hectic 10 days before Liverpool vs Everton By Gary Cotterill, Sky Sports News HQ reporter   8:13pm Divock Origi is facing the prospect of three matches in 10 days, including a World Cup Qualifier and a Merseyside derby Divock Origi is facing a hectic 10 days before the Merseyside derby â€“ but the Liverpool forward is not complaining. 
Origi is currently away on international duty and is likely to feature for Belgium in their World Cup Qualifier against Greece on Saturday, live on Sky Sports 2 HD from 7.30pm, and friendly with Russia on Tuesday. 
Following that, the 21-year-old will return to Melwood and turn his focus towards Liverpool's clash with neighbours Everton on April 1, live on Sky Sports 1 HD from 11.30am. Liverpool vs Everton 
His Belgium team-mates Simon Mignolet (Liverpool), Romelu Lukaku (Everton) and Kevin Mirallas (Everton) also face a quick turnaround ahead of the match at Anfield, but Origi is taking the potentially heavy schedule in his stride. 
"We'll get back home on Wednesday" Origi told Sky Sports News HQ . 
"As a footballer you need to adapt. It will be a long trip, then all the focus will be on recovery. Origi is preparing for Belgium;s double-header against Greece and Russia 
"It's a big game. A big game. Everton are in a good way at the moment so it will be an important game for both teams." 
Origi has started just seven matches for Liverpool this season and is likely to begin the match against the Toffees on the bench, with Roberto Firmino, Sadio Mane and Philippe Coutinho the preferred front three under Jurgen Klopp.
